Description: Frame of approximately 20 charred fragments of papyri (largest 3 x 4 cm), similar to EA 10837 in character and in shape. Some fragments have been removed, possibly mounted with EA 10837. Traces of script are visible, demotic.
Curator's comments: Previously unregistered. Identified in 2009 in trays of miscellaneous material that had been moved into store room M4. Being studied by Kim Ryholt (Copenhagen).
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: carbonised, fragmented, fragile Black ink: visible with infra-red Red ink: ? Mount Details: Sandwich: glass (dirty) Binding: Kraft paper, Box: purpose made with Plastazote padding Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: E
